attributes.action: Introduce a law which makes it legally binding to put an offer on buying a house
attributes.background: Too many people in England now offer on multiple houses and then choose later on as to which one they want. This collapses chains and costs the time and money of other people trying to move house. This law could allow expenses to be recovered against the party that pulls out.
attributes.additional_details: A commonly cited reason by people who do not want to move is that they fear a chain collapsing. Creating this law would ensure people to only offer on one house and therefore only complete one chain.

attributes.action: Criminal Record checks on drivers of taxis and private hire a legal requirement.
attributes.background: Currently no legal requirement only recommendations. There should be mandatory checks in place as a minimum requirement. Licences should be removed from those found to have violent or sexual convictions. We have a duty to protect women, children and the vulnerable and less able.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers of taxis and private hire vehicles are currently allowed to keep their licences and continue to work even if they have criminal convictions.

attributes.action: Create a UK group to design, construct and operate UK nuclear power stations
attributes.background: 51% of all electricity generated in UK is by Gas and Coal powered stations. 21% is generated by old Nuclear plants. We need to replace these with new nuclear power stations. I believe that the UK should design, develop, construct and operate these with UK skills by creating a UK Nuclear Power Group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government should create a UK Nuclear Power Group to manage, design, develop, construct and operate the new Nuclear power stations required for our UK national electricity grid. 
A UK group would not only create thousands of jobs in the UK, using the skills that are developed in the UK and ensure the security of the electric network remained in our control.

attributes.action: We want the Government to Stop the unjustified rise in the cost of funerals.
attributes.background: The Government needs to bring into force regulations to limit the exorbitant cost of Funerals & Cremations.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all unpaid carers receive appropriate training
attributes.background: Adult unpaid carers save the UK economy billions of pounds each year and despite being under supported, carers are delivering cost effective day to day invaluable care and support which for most carers becomes a full time job. Carers should have a legal right to receive appropriate ongoing training
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities are charged with supporting unpaid carers under the care act. Local authorities already ensure regular routine training and support packages to other carers, I.E. foster carers, with a dedicated support team which is made available 24/7. Local authorities should be legally bound to manage, support, provide and ensure ongoing training for unpaid carers. Without certified training, unpaid carers are being left vulnerable, unprotected and isolated.

attributes.action: Require MPs to give a full explanation when they refuse to represent you.
attributes.background: MP can refuse to represent constituents and choose not to reply to any form of communication unless legally obligated eg subject access request. They do not need to give an explanation, it leaves constituents cut off from all lines of communication if they wish to ask questions of their government.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no way to challenge their decision. 

Apparently it’s an MP’s democratic right to not represent you or give an explanation which I find utterly ridiculous as they are there to hold the government accountable. 

This ability that MPs have to cut off constituents from questioning their government is wholly unacceptable. The rules should be changed so they have to give an explanation.

attributes.action: Make detentions in schools illegal if the parent's do not give consent.
attributes.background: I believe after-school detentions of students without parental consent should be banned because it is unfair to the parents if they have something planned and occasionally schools give detentions in poor judgement so I think its important to show the parent's opinion on the matter.

attributes.action: Add electric pet containment systems (‘invisible fences’) to the e-collar ban.
attributes.background:
The recent e-collar ban is fundamentally flawed in still permitting use of electric containment systems which make similar use of the fear- and pain-based so-called ‘training aid’. 
‘Invisible fences’ inflict the same aversive stimulus on pets, scientifically proven to negatively affect welfare.

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: Close the legal loopholes in the High Hedges legislation
attributes.background: Part 8 of the Anti-Social Behaviour Act 2003 introduced legislation to combat the scourge of fast-growing evergreens like Leylandii which, when planted in a line as a hedge has blighted the lives of those living in neighbouring properties.
attributes.additional_details: A high hedge is defined as two or more evergreens, more that 2m tall planted in a line and where the branches meet so as to provide a barrier to light. Enforcement of high hedges legislation is the responsibility of councils.  However, the legislation does not cover individual trees and therefore people are merely cutting gaps in their hedges so that the former hedge becomes a line of individual trees which despite being large, cannot be dealt with by councils under the high hedges legislation.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. It’s a choice people have.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Increase NHS budgets to help acid attack victims
attributes.background: Acid Attack victims face not only physical pain but also mental trauma that should be urgently helped. This can happen if the NHS budget increases so that there are more facilities available for this kind of treatment as the budget cuts to the NHS could hinder these emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: Victims of this heinous crime have to wait due to the lack of facilities to help them because of the NHS budget cut that makes it harder to treat them. Victims have to wait for longer periods of time that could take up to months or even years to book for their own appointments which should not be happening.

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on the Membership of NATO.
attributes.background: The British public should have an opportunity to determine whether the country should play a role in the future in the The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
attributes.additional_details: NATO was founded in 1949 by the United States as a military alliance between western nations to oppose the Soviet Union and serve a purpose in defending the west against the eastern block. However, today NATO is now a cold war relic. Britain should take control over its military affairs and its foreign policy to prevent the country from getting involved in wars.  We should follow our own operations rather than following NATO.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: Exempt animals purchased from a rescue centre from VAT on vets bills
attributes.background: To discourage unnecessary breeding of animals which are over represented in rescue centres, I am asking that any animal purchased from a rescue centre should be exempt from the 20% VAT on vets’s bills and a corresponding reduction in their insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details:
This would encourage people to buy from rescue centres and discourage the breeding purely for money of those breeds which are over represented in rescue centres.
Owners would register proof of purchase from a recognised rescue centre with their vet and have their record marked as exempt from VAT.

attributes.action: Introduce unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives
attributes.background: My mother at the beginning of 2018 became seriously ill, and was admitted to hospital. Work was very good about it and gave me compassionate leave so I could go and see her
attributes.additional_details:
6/8/2018 I was told mum had only days left to live, but I was told I couldn’t have compassionate leave as I was not entitled to any and would have to phone in sick. 

I think it’s disrespectful not to be given compassionate leave for a dying relative, my mum passed that week. And basically lost two weeks wages. I think this is wrong for anyone to go through.

Unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives, would solve this issue for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Suspend foreign aid until the national debt has been payed off.
attributes.background: We have a national debt to service, if we give 14.5 billion by 2021 in foreign aid we are borrowing money to give away whilst we lack funds for domestic programs

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Make it the law that truck  drivers have air con in their sleeping areas.
attributes.background: My son is a truck driver and he all his colleagues are really feeling unsafe in this heat. Currently company owners do not have to ensure the sleeping area is cooled. There have been reports of cab temperatures reaching in excess of 50 degrees. We wouldn’t do this to a dog, let’s not do it to them

attributes.action: Freeze Rent / Mortgage payments for poorly people who are not be fit to work.
attributes.background: People are getting evicted from their homes due to not being able to afford their rent / mortgage payments when they have a serious illness such as cancer. Sometimes benefits won't cover the mortgage / rent payments.
attributes.additional_details: Help sick people to stay in their homes by covering their rent payments in full through benefits or if they have a mortgage then freeze their payments until they are fit to return to work.

attributes.action: Make practicing beauty/nail/hairdressing treatments without insurance illegal
attributes.background: There are thousands of unlicensed and uninsured treatments being carried out in beauty every day by untrained people . This puts the public at risk due to various chemicals used and takes business from qualified professionals who have spent years and thousands on training and insurance.
attributes.additional_details: Use of social media has made it easy for untrained freelance therapists, make up artists, technicians and hairdressers to promote themselves to the public who are unaware of the risks they are taking when using these services. Many do not even hold mandatory public liability insurance meaning that any damages or reactions caused by improper use of products and chemicals is uncovered. This puts the public in danger of life-changing deformities by negligence of the persons performing treatments.

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action:
Change minimum wage to at least £10 an hour. 

Stop the struggle!
attributes.background:
Life is a struggle already, without factoring in the low minimum wage the uk are made to endure. Living cost keeps going up, but we are all stuck trying to climb back on top.

We need this to change our country and to better it, and create a future that is bright.
attributes.additional_details:
Life within our current economic climate is a struggle, and stability is essentially unachievable. Living costs are increasing but minimum wage is staying the same. 

Therefore, we need to galvanise our country  into making a change and to ensure our future generations are prosperous

attributes.action: To set up a scheme to support banks and building societies who offer 95% LTV
attributes.background: I would like call upon the Government to set up a scheme to support banks and building societies who offer 95 -98 % LTV mortgages to tenants who have been renting for 36 months or more to be able to obtain a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 3,700 homes are standing empty in Leicester and Leicestershire.
Latest figures obtained by the BBC show that 1,336 homes are unoccupied in the city and a further 2,372 around the county are also currently not lived in.
A further 183 in Rutland are also empty.
We have also become a nation of renters, with rents higher then some mortgage payments, tenants should be able to buy on the open market esp First time Home buyers.

attributes.action: Redefine the term ‘majority’ in regards to referendums as a minimum of 65%.
attributes.background: 52% is NOT  majority; this means that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. The government needs to redefine the term 'majority' in a referendum to 65% minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries, such as the US, a major change to the constitution requires two-thirds majority in both the Senate and House of Representatives. The fact that in the UK a result of just over 50% can constitute a major change can and has led to major social divisions within the country whilst also meaning that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. This makes the country vulnerable to disinformation.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36306681

attributes.action: Create a single register of eligible voters managed by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
Currently local registration offices manage over 350 electoral rolls in the UK.

This petition calls for creation of a single register to be managed by the independent Electoral Commission.

Such a register would help promote public confidence in the democratic process and ensure its integrity.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all meat products to carry an image of the animal killed
attributes.background: People disassociate the meat that they eat with the animal that has been killed. The compulsory labelling of meat products with an image of the animal that has been killed will mean people need to acknowledge that an animal has died for the meat or animal product that they eat.

attributes.action: Free Glasses for anyone who needs them NO MATTER THE AGE! Especially students.
attributes.background: As if being a full time student on a budget isn’t hard enough, as soon as I reached 19 years old I was no longer allowed to receive free glasses. Obviously, this was very annoying seeing as I need them, because of my astigmatism I need special lenses which cost a FORTUNE!
attributes.additional_details: I personally believe that glasses should be free to whoever needs them if they cannot afford them, there should be some sort of scheme, not only the NHS. Appointments are free for students but after that you have to pay between £69-£200 for a pair of glassss not including the extra charges to get special lenses fitted in for anyone with eye deficiencies, like myself. If abortions & sex changes through the NHS are free, why do we have to pay for a pair of glasses? - Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Children who are registered for home education to have mandatory welfare checks.
attributes.background: When a child is removed from the school roll and registered for home education, there is a loss of the safeguarding layer of that child that teachers and schools currently provide. Parents have no legal obligation to let education department visit the home and determine if a suitable environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who are home schooled are at risk of becoming hidden children, with the opportunity to identify risks to their welfare in their home environment severely diminished. 
A simple welfare check on a monthly or quarterly basis would be key to preventing these scenarios.

attributes.action: Remove anonymity from MPs accused of misconduct.
attributes.background: MPs have voted to grant themselves anonymity if accused of sexual harassment or expenses misconduct. They will remain anonymous while being investigated – and might not be named even if they are judged guilty.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should not have rights above those of ordinary people. Otherwise, even if they get caught, we may never know.

attributes.action: Mandatory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth Workers
attributes.background: Compulsory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth workers will ensure that leaders know what to do if a young person is experiencing a mental health crisis. By recognising the signs early and knowing what to do in each circumstance, leaders can create greater safety for young people.
attributes.additional_details: If a young person grazes their knee, or breaks their ankle while on a residential, noticing the symptoms and treating the problem can be simple for a first aider. If a mental health crisis occurs, the issue may be troublesome to overcome if a leader is not trained in mental health first aid. 1 in 10 young people experience a mental health issue at a given time (https://mhfaengland.org/individuals/youth/) yet the subject is still stigmatised and brushed under the carpet. https://mhfaengland.org/

attributes.action: Abolish business rates in favour of sales tax to rejuvenate town centres.
attributes.background: Town centres are dying because of crippling business rates so a sales tax makes sense to reduce burdens on start up businesses.

attributes.action: All Diabetes sufferers should be entitled to free dental treatment
attributes.background: I was diagnosed with Type II Diabetes in 2016. I hadn't required any dental treatment for over 10 years but suddenly felt that my gums were receding. The dentist later told me that diabetic people are very prone to gum disease. Besides free eye tests and feet checks, dental care should be included.
attributes.additional_details:
People with diabetes are at greater risk for dental problems.

They're more likely to have infections of their gums and the bones that hold their teeth in place, because diabetes can reduce the blood supply to the gums.

High blood sugar may also cause dry mouth and make gum disease worse. Less saliva can allow more tooth-decaying bacteria and plaque buildup.

attributes.action: Abolish the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991
attributes.background: Thousands of unwanted dogs (primarily Pitbulls) are put down because of the Dangerous Dogs Act which makes it illegal for breeds which are classified as 'dangerous' to be rehomed to a loving owner and have to be euthanized if they become unwanted by their original owner.

attributes.action: Parliament to set aside time to debate the rules whereby MPs put forward bills
attributes.background: Following the wrecking of two bills which had received extensive scrutiny by departments, and were supported by ministers, by a single MP calling "object" on a Friday afternoon, time should be set aside by Parliament to consider and amend the rules whereby MPs can introduce bills to the House.
attributes.additional_details: A single MP is currently able to wreck private members' bills by talking them out, or objecting.

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: Ban alcohol and gambling sponsors in sport.
attributes.background:
Our nation is getting worse with alcohol and gambling, young children, teens are being exposed to bad influences that it is good to drink alcohol and gamble as it is good to watch sport such as football. Children are seeing this as a norm and have become addicts.
It is time to stop this.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for urinals to have a partition that offers privacy
attributes.background: Urinating and exposing yourself in a public toilet is an uncomfortable situation at the best of times. It's time a privacy partition is installed in all toilets across the country, and give us the privacy we deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Just because we can urinate in public, does not mean we like exposing ourselves.

Nearly 4 million people in the UK are affected by paruresis or shy bladder syndrome, which can be a physically and socially uncomfortable condition. 
 
We need to make it a legal requirement for all urinals across the country to have decent privacy and help people conquer toilet anxiety.

attributes.action: Allow the NHS to accept financial donations at a national level
attributes.background: There's one thing everyone agrees on in the UK, everyone values the NHS. The incredible impact from NHS staff is felt by family and friends near and far. Yet while the Government discusses blanket tax rises, they fail to recognise the easiest route to raising cash, through voluntary donations.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is possible to donate to small pockets of the NHS, mainly NHS Trusts, however, this doesn't go far enough and it's pretty hard to access. 

In 2017, the RNLI raised £196m (this figure grows year on year) through fundraising, imagine if the NHS created a central pot to accept donations.

attributes.action: Impose a maximum booking fee on online cinema ticket purchases.
attributes.background: Some cinemas can charge upwards of £1.75 on top of the price of a ticket just to book it online instead of at the cinema which is blatantly extortionate. A reasonable cap either as a fixed amount or as a percentage of the ticket price should be imposed.

attributes.action: Grant full time students access to a Maternity Allowance
attributes.background: Many full time students who fall pregnant or give birth during their studies, are unable to access statutory maternity pay or allowance. These are one of the few groups of women who are missing out on their maternity rights. Let’s give full time students access to maternity allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of access occurs when a student hasn’t worked in the qualifying period - you can see how that works here (see maternity allowance and statutory maternity pay): 
https://www.staffsunion.com/advice/money/financeguides/parents/

We suggest full time students should automatically have access to maternity allowance or that a special allowance be drawn up to accommodate these cases that provides equivalent support.

attributes.action: Allow Chris Brown entry into the U.K.
attributes.background: In 2010, Chris Brown was refused permission to enter the U.K. on the grounds of being guilty of a serious criminal offence. Since then, Chris Brown has paid the price for his earlier mistakes and has shown time and time again that he is a changed man through his actions and his music.
attributes.additional_details: Home office stated in 2010, “public safety is one of our primary concerns”, however, Mr. Brown poses no threat to the general public. Instead he is a source of joy to his fans, especially those in the U.K. who can only experience this vicariously through his social media presence. Therefore we ask that you please sign this petition, so our government can consider a reversal of the refusal of his entry to the U.K.

attributes.action: Regulate Airbnb and other short term lets of under one month
attributes.background: Properties are being changed from homes into cheap accommodation. This subjects the Hotel and B&B industry to unfair competition, increases rents as there are less properties available. This is also contributing to homelessness and is destroying local communities
attributes.additional_details: Make it the law that all Airbnbs and other short term lets of under one month have to require a change of use through the Local Planning Authority and be registered. They will also have to apply for the same entertainment and alcohol licences plus food hygiene and health and safety regulations as a Hotel or Bed & Breakfast. They will have to reapply annually for their licence and objections can be raised as in any other licensed premises. The property will also be subject to business rates

attributes.action: universal credit to pay rent cost during the 4week period before first payment
attributes.background: Universal credit is causing a big problem for people falling into rent arrears at the beginning the claim by making the claimant have to wait an initial period of 4-5 weeks before issuing the first Payment in which rent arrears are building up and already people are at risk of Losing their homes.
attributes.additional_details: There used to be help for when people returned to work by giving a grace period of 1 months extra housing benefit to help with the transition from jobseekers allowance to work before the housing benefit was cancelled. Could something like this be actioned?  especially when you are moving people from an old existing benefit into the new umbrella of universal credit and rent arrears will have started accumulating. Was this 4-5wk period never thought about?! and the awful knock on effect to follow?
